artist: Artist: Ōta Masamitsu; Carver: Itō Susumu; Printer: Itō Harutarō
creditline: Gift of funds from Gordon Brodfuehrer, and Jane Worsley in honor of Lydya Kuhn
description: figure in gold, green, and black, with blue, black, and white mask, gripping long brown hair; black and gray background with several red, orange, and green leaves; Japanese script on left and right sides of sheet
inscription: stamped impression in LL corner of sheet: 106 | verso LR in pencil: (illegible)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Figures on the Stage in the Shōwa Period (Shōwa butai sugata 昭和舞台姿)
text: This is the most dramatic design of Ōta Masamitsu’s 12-print series Figures on the Stage in the Shōwa Period (Shōwa butai sugata), showing popular actors in the kabuki stage in the mid-20th century. It shows the actor Onoe Kikugorō VI (1885–1949) in the dance “Gathering Autumn Leaves” (Momojigari). Momijigari is a short dance showing a woman who is transformed into a vicious demon and it is highly demanding on the actor since he must undergo a quick costume change during the performance.
title: No. 9, Actor Onoe Kikugoro VI in the play "Gathering Autumn Leaves"
